revised_title: High Mode Number Stability of Toroidal Plasmas
tldr: The authors present a method to investigate the stability of axisymmetric toroidal plasmas with high mode numbers. They develop a transformation that reconciles long parallel wavelength, short perpendicular wavelength, and periodicity in a sheared toroidal magnetic field. The transformation allows for an eikonal representation of the perturbation, which is then used to analyze the stability of the plasma. The lowest-order theory determines the local oscillation frequency and structure of the mode along the magnetic field, while higher-order theories determine the transverse structure and the relation between the local and true eigenvalues.
